data.title: University of Houston Athletics
data.meta_description: Jacob Garza (56) LS - As a Sophomore (2023) First Team Fall Academic All-Big 12 Conference Appeared in all 12 games Primary punt long snapper (49 snaps) 13 s...
data.text:
As a Sophomore (2023)

First Team Fall Academic All-Big 12 Conference

Appeared in all 12 games

Primary punt long snapper (49 snaps)

13 snaps as field goal snapper â€“ all over final four games

Played part in UH ranking 29th nationally in punt return defense (5.00)

As a Redshirt Freshman (2022)

2022-23 American Athletic Conference All-Academic Team

Appeared in seven games

15 snaps as punt long snapper

Cougars did not allow a blocked punt

Houston ranked third in The American in net punting (40.55)

As a Freshman (2021)

Redshirted

Did not see action

As a Freshman (2020)

American Athletic Conference All-Academic Team

Appeared in four games (24 snaps)

16 snaps as punt long snapper

Eight snaps as field goal long snapper

High School

Prepped at Veterans Memorial High School

Primarily a defensive back

91 tackles, five interceptions, nine pass breakups and three defensive TDs

All-state as a junior and senior

All-Valley Defensive Player of Year as a senior

First Team All-District Offense and Defense as a senior

Personal

Hobbies: Working out, hiking, the beach and hanging out with friends

Dream job outside football: sports psychologist

Has been working in family business since childhood

Hidden talent: taking things apart and rebuilding them

Chose UH because of its combination between academics and athletics

One word to describe himself on the field: focused

If he could eat one food for the rest of his life: Ramen Noodles

His motivation for working hard: his parents

Best advice: focus on the things that affect you

Highlight of his life thus far: being alive and surrounded by a loving family

Sports hero: Ray Lewis because of his leadership

Life focus: helping and supporting other people
